title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Anemones, [Anemones] for the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]", 1821–24
medium:
Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite
on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer A. Samuels, New York.
description: Garden setting with chinoiserie pagoda in left background. Male gardner and gentleman stand and bow before each other in middle of anemone beds. Two other men appear behind them, one kneeling and examining flowers, other seated, with a brush between his teeth regarding his sketchbook.  A woman appears in doorway of the garden wall in right background before which a young boy plays with a butterfly net. Matted with 1989-13-1.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Anemones, [Anemones] for the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]", 1821–24.Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite
on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper. 1989-13-2.
